meanings.definition: The branch of biology that deals with the geographical distribution of animals.
meanings.sent1: Zoogeography helps scientists understand where different animals live around the world.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use zoogeography to study how animals are spread out across different regions.
meanings.sent3: The professor made zoogeography sound like a treasure hunt for animal locations.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the zoogeography of the ocean depths is like uncovering a hidden map of underwater creatures.
meanings.sent5: Learning about zoogeography is like piecing together a puzzle of animal habitats.

meanings.definition: The study of the geographical distribution of animal species.
meanings.sent1: Zoogeography involves mapping out where different animal species are found on Earth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists rely on zoogeography to understand why certain animal species live in specific areas.
meanings.sent3: During the zoogeography class, the students imagined animals racing to claim their territories.
meanings.sent4: The zoogeography of the savannah can be likened to a complex game of chess among animal populations.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of zoogeography paint a vivid picture of the diverse habitats animals inhabit.
